001package imagingbook.lib.math.eigen;
002
003/**
004 * Interface for classes performing eigenvalue/eigenvector calculations.
005 *
006 */
007public interface RealEigensolver {
008        
009        /**
010         * Returns the size of the system (N = number of rows and columns).
011         * @return size of the system (N)
012         */
013        public int getSize();
014        
015        /**
016         * Returns {@code true} iff all eigenvalues of the associated matrix are real.
017         * @return as described
018         */
019        public boolean isReal();
020        
021        /**
022         * Returns a vector of real eigenvalues in no specific order.
023         * {@code NaN} is inserted for complex eigenvalues.
024         * @return an array of eigenvalues
025         */
026        public double[] getEigenvalues();
027        
028        /**
029         * Returns the k-th eigenvalue (&lambda;_k, for k = 0,...,N-1).
030         * {@code NaN} is returned if the associated eigenvalue
031         * is complex-valued (non-real).
032         * @param k index 
033         * @return the k-th eigenvalue (&lambda;<sub>k</sub>)
034         */
035        public double getEigenvalue(int k);
036        
037        /**
038         * Returns a matrix whose columns are the eigenvectors of the
039         * solution, arranged in the same order as the eigenvalues
040         * returned by {@link #getEigenvalues()}. 
041         * 
042         * @return a matrix of eigenvectors (column vectors)
043         */
044        public double[][] getEigenvectors();
045        
046        /**
047         * Returns the k-th eigenvector (x_k, for k = 0,...,N-1).
048         * The ordering of the returned eigenvectors is the same as for the
049         * eigenvalues returned by {@link #getEigenvalues()}.
050         * @param k index
051         * @return the k-th eigenvector (x<sub>k</sub>)
052         */
053        public double[] getEigenvector(int k);
054
055
056}
